etymology.description: 毛泽东(Mao Zedong) + 思想(thought) = Mao Zedong Thought
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the body of political theory attributed to Mao Zedong and developed within the Chinese Communist Party, especially during the revolutionary period and early PRC. Often associated with ideas such as the mass line, people’s war, and continuous revolution under proletarian dictatorship.
etymology.simplification: 澤→泽 and 東→东 were simplified to reduce stroke counts in PRC script reform; 毛、思、想 unchanged.

parts.english: hair; fur; coarse; tenth of a yuan

examples.chinese: 毛泽东思想是中国共产党指导思想之一(毛澤東思想是中國共產黨指導思想之一)。
examples.pinyin: Máo Zédōng Sīxiǎng shì Zhōngguó Gòngchǎndǎng zhǐdǎo sīxiǎng zhī yī.
examples.english: Mao Zedong Thought is one of the guiding ideologies of the Communist Party of China.

examples.chinese: 学者研究其形成背景与历史影响(學者研究其形成背景與歷史影響)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yánjiū qí xíngchéng bèijǐng yǔ lìshǐ yǐngxiǎng.
examples.english: Scholars study its formative context and historical influence.
